content: I am a student of M.S. Computer Science in the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at National University of Sciences & Technology, Islamabad. My research is focused on the applications of deep learning in computer vision and natural language processing, particularly using unsupervised and transfer learning techniques. Currently, I’m working on real-time face retrieval from video streams at the MachVIS Lab.
summary: I am a student of M.S. Computer Science in the School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science at National University of Sciences & Technology, Islamabad. My research is focused on the applications of deep learning in computer vision and natural language processing, particularly using unsupervised and transfer learning techniques.
title: Atif Khurshid

summary: A study of efficient face retrieval techniques in a real-time video stream analytics system with the aim of generating a large-scale face dataset.
title: StreamFace - Extracting a large-scale face dataset from live streams

summary: A study of cross-lingual transfer learning of grammatical features in a transformer model for multilingual surface realisation.
title: Transfer learning grammar for multilingual surface realisation

summary: A study of cross-lingual transfer learning of grammatical features in a transformer model for multilingual surface realisation.
title: Transfer learning grammar for multilingual surface realisation

summary: Extendible framework for incorporation of arbitrary machine learning models in online network intrusion detection systems.
title: Online machine learning-based framework for network intrusion detection

summary: Implemented a Deep Residual Neural Network to detect Atrial Fibrillation using the dataset from PhysioNet Computing in Cardiology Challenge 2017.
title: Heart disease classification using deep residual learning
